fieldlist.name: ALL
fieldlist.description: All terms from all searchable fields

fieldlist.name: MESH
fieldlist.description: Medical Subject Headings assigned to publication

fieldlist.name: MAJR
fieldlist.description: MeSH terms of major importance to publication

fieldlist.name: ECNO
fieldlist.description: EC number for enzyme or CAS registry number

fieldlist.name: SUBS
fieldlist.description: CAS chemical name or MEDLINE Substance Name

fieldlist.name: EDAT
fieldlist.description: Date publication first accessible through Entrez

fieldlist.name: SI
fieldlist.description: Cross-reference from publication to other databases

fieldlist.name: MHDA
fieldlist.description: Date publication was indexed with MeSH terms

fieldlist.name: TT
fieldlist.description: Words in transliterated title of publication

fieldlist.name: CRDT
fieldlist.description: Date publication first accessible through Entrez

fieldlist.name: BOOK
fieldlist.description: ID of the book that contains the document

linklist.name: pubmed_assembly
linklist.description: Assembly

linklist.name: pubmed_bioproject
linklist.description: Related Projects

linklist.name: pubmed_biosample
linklist.description: BioSample links

linklist.name: pubmed_biosystems
linklist.description: Pathways and biological systems (BioSystems) that cite the current articles. Citations are from the BioSystems source databases (KEGG and BioCyc).

linklist.name: pubmed_books_refs
linklist.description: NCBI Bookshelf books that cite the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_cdd
linklist.description: Conserved Domain Database (CDD) records that cite the current articles. Citations are from the CDD source database records (PFAM, SMART).

linklist.name: pubmed_dbvar
linklist.description: Link from PubMed to dbVar

linklist.name: pubmed_epigenomics_experiment
linklist.description: Links to experimental data from epigenomic studies

linklist.name: pubmed_epigenomics_sample
linklist.description: Links to descriptions of biological samples used in epigenomic studies

linklist.name: pubmed_epigenomics_study
linklist.description: Links to overviews of epigenomic studies

linklist.name: pubmed_gap
linklist.description: Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) studies that cite the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_gds
linklist.description: Gene expression and molecular abundance data reported in the current articles that are also included in the curated Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) DataSets.

linklist.name: pubmed_gene
linklist.description: Gene records that cite the current articles. Citations in Gene are added manually by NCBI or imported from outside public resources.

linklist.name: pubmed_gene_bookrecords
linklist.description: Gene records in this citation

linklist.name: pubmed_gene_citedinomim
linklist.description: Gene records associated with Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that cite the current articles in their reference lists.

linklist.name: pubmed_gene_rif
linklist.description: Gene records that have the current articles as Reference into Function citations (GeneRIFs). NLM staff reviewing the literature while indexing MEDLINE add GeneRIFs manually.

linklist.name: pubmed_genome
linklist.description: Genome records that include the current articles as references. These are typically the articles that report the sequencing and analysis of the genome.

linklist.name: pubmed_geoprofiles
linklist.description: Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) Profiles of molecular abundance data. The current articles are references on the Gene record associated with the GEO profile.

linklist.name: pubmed_homologene
linklist.description: HomoloGene clusters of homologous genes and sequences that cite the current articles. These are references on the Gene and sequence records in the HomoloGene entry.

linklist.name: pubmed_medgen
linklist.description: Related information in MedGen

linklist.name: pubmed_medgen_omim
linklist.description: Related information in MedGen (OMIM)

linklist.name: pubmed_nuccore
linklist.description: Primary database (GenBank) nucleotide records reported in the current articles as well as Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that include the articles as references.

linklist.name: pubmed_nuccore_refseq
linklist.description: NCBI nucleotide Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that are cited in the current articles, included in the corresponding Gene Reference into Function, or that include the PubMed articles as references.

linklist.name: pubmed_nuccore_weighted
linklist.description: Nucleotide records associated with the current articles through the Gene database. These are the related sequences on the Gene record that are added manually by NCBI.

linklist.name: pubmed_nucest
linklist.description: Expressed Sequence Tag (EST) nucleotide sequence records reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_nucgss
linklist.description: Genome Survey Sequence (GSS) nucleotide records reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_omia
linklist.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Animals (OMIA) records that cite the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_omim_bookrecords
linklist.description: OMIM records in this citation

linklist.name: pubmed_omim_calculated
linklist.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that include the current articles as references in the light bulb links within or in the citations at the end of the OMIM record. The references available through the light bulb link are collected using the PubMed related articles algorithm to identify records with similar terminology to the OMIM record.

linklist.name: pubmed_omim_cited
linklist.description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that include the current articles as reference cited at the end of the OMIM record.

linklist.name: pubmed_pcassay
linklist.description: PubChem BioAssay experiments on the biological activities of small molecules that cite the current articles. The depositors of BioAssay data provide these references.

linklist.name: pubmed_pccompound
linklist.description: PubChem chemical compound records that cite the current articles. These references are taken from those provided on submitted PubChem chemical substance records. Multiple substance records may contribute to the PubChem compound record.

linklist.name: pubmed_pccompound_mesh
linklist.description: PubChem chemical compound records that are classified under the same Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) controlled vocabulary as the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_pccompound_publisher
linklist.description: Link to publisher deposited structures in the PubChem Compound database.

linklist.name: pubmed_pcsubstance
linklist.description: PubChem chemical substance records that cite the current articles. These references are taken from those provided on submitted PubChem chemical substance records.

linklist.name: pubmed_pcsubstance_bookrecords
linklist.description: Structures in the PubChem Substance database in this citation

linklist.name: pubmed_pcsubstance_mesh
linklist.description: PubChem chemical substance (submitted) records that are classified under the same Medical Subject Headings (MeSH) controlled vocabulary as the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_pcsubstance_publisher
linklist.description: Publisher deposited structures in the PubChem Compound database that are reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_pmc
linklist.description: Free full-text versions of the current articles in the PubMed Central database.

linklist.name: pubmed_pmc_bookrecords
linklist.menu: References in PMC for this Bookshelf citation
linklist.description: Full text of articles in PubMed Central cited in this record

linklist.name: pubmed_pmc_embargo
linklist.description: Embargoed PMC article associated with PubMed

linklist.name: pubmed_pmc_local
linklist.description: Free full text articles in PMC

linklist.name: pubmed_pmc_refs
linklist.description: Full-text articles in the PubMed Central Database that cite the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_popset
linklist.description: Sets of sequences from population and evolutionary genetic studies in the PopSet database reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_probe
linklist.description: Molecular reagents in the Probe database that cite the current articles. References in Probe are provided by submitters of the data.

linklist.name: pubmed_protein
linklist.description: Protein translation features of primary database (GenBank) nucleotide records reported in the current articles as well as Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that include the articles as references.

linklist.name: pubmed_protein_refseq
linklist.description: NCBI protein Reference Sequences (RefSeqs) that are cited in the current articles, included in the corresponding Gene Reference into Function, or that include the PubMed articles as references.

linklist.name: pubmed_protein_weighted
linklist.description: Protein records associated with the current articles through related Gene database records. These are the related sequences on the Gene record that are added manually by NCBI.

linklist.name: pubmed_proteinclusters
linklist.description: Clusters of related proteins from the Protein Clusters database that cite the current articles. Sources of references in Protein Clusters include the associated Gene and Conserved Domain records as well as NCBI added citations.

linklist.name: pubmed_pubmed
linklist.description: Calculated set of PubMed citations closely related to the selected article(s) retrieved using a word weight algorithm. Related articles are displayed in ranked order from most to least relevant, with the “linked from” citation displayed first.

linklist.name: pubmed_pubmed_bookrecords
linklist.description: PubMed abstracts for articles cited in this record

linklist.name: pubmed_pubmed_refs
linklist.description: Citation referenced in PubMed article. Only valid for PubMed citations that are also in PMC.

linklist.name: pubmed_snp
linklist.description: Nucleotide polymorphism records from dbSNP that have current articles as submitter-provided references.

linklist.name: pubmed_snp_cited
linklist.description: Nucleotide polymorphism records from dbSNP that have NCBI dbSNP identifiers reported in the PubMed abstract of the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_sra
linklist.description: Massively-parallel sequencing project data in the Short Read Archive (SRA) that are reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_structure
linklist.description: Three-dimensional structure records in the NCBI Structure database for data reported in the current articles.

linklist.name: pubmed_taxonomy_entrez
linklist.description: Taxonomy records associated with the current articles through taxonomic information on related molecular database records (Nucleotide, Protein, Gene, SNP, Structure).

linklist.name: pubmed_unigene
linklist.description: UniGene clusters of expressed sequences that are associated with the current articles through references on the clustered sequence records and related Gene records.

linklist.name: pubmed_unists
linklist.description: Genetic, physical, and sequence mapping reagents in the UniSTS database associated with the current articles through references on sequence tagged site (STS) submissions as well as automated searching of PubMed abstracts and full-text PubMed Central articles for marker names.
